A mantra (Sanskrit: मन्त्र) is a sacred utterance, a numinous sound, a syllable, word or phonemes, or group of words in Sanskrit believed to have psychological and spiritual powers. They are typically melodic, mathematically structured meters, believed to be resonant with numinous qualities. 

At its simplest, the word ॐ (Aum, Om) serves as a mantra, also known as the source of all mantras. 

Each mantra carries a certain amount of positive vibration, which when repeated regularly over a period of time can generate tranquil emotions, peace of mind and bestow oneself with sound body and health.

 ✧✧✧ 

Start by adding your personal list of mantras, with each mantra having a defined chanting goal. We also recommend you to Sign in with your Google account in order to keep all your Chanting data backed up.

A Mala is a sacred rosary in the form of a garland used for keeping count while reciting, chanting, or mentally repeating a mantra or the name of a deity. This sādhanā (practice) is known in Sanskrit as Japa. A typical Mala is generally made with 18, 27, 54 or 108 beads.

According to Védās (Ancient Indian Texts), the recommended amount of Japa required in the current epoch i.e. "Kaliyuga", for a Mantra to become fruitful is given below.

 ⦿ Japa - 1,25,000
 ⦿ Hawan - 12,500 
 ⦿ Tarpan - 1,250
 ⦿ Maarjan - 125
 ⦿ Brahman Bhoj - 13

Alternatively, instead of involving oneself in these rigorous rituals, one can gain similar benefits by piously chanting an amount equivalent to the combined total of all the above, which turns out to be 1,38,888 approximately.

Moreover, in order to nullify the effects of any erroneous chants, it is also recommended to add a buffer amount to the sum and make it a total of 1,50,000 chants.

Now, if we consider an ideal Japa Mala consisting of 108 beads, we must diligently complete a total of 1,500 Malas in order to successfully reach an ideal chanting goal for a given Mantra.
